result.execSummary:
The defendant Marvin White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Marvin White is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Marvin White was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consec to sentence currently serving in 10CF955.  Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.  Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge remitted. $268  to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.  The balance remaining at release from prison be paid as a condition of extended supervision or parole at a rate determined by the supervising agent.
Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
